column4: My friend is asking if he need to install Okular . Because he is worried about evince to do not open some file types properly. For example doc files can not open from OpenOffice properly bu can open them. Can someone please answer me ? Thank you!
I believe okular is kde  pdf reader   yes??
yes it is kde reader but we can install it also.
yes you can install it   ... it will also install many kde libraries and dependencies as well
we can install i know. but we are asking if there is a possibility that evince to do not open a filetype and okular will ?
oh  I see.... well let me check in okular hold on
which file types are you hoping okular opens?

my friend is using many filetypes because of his job. But i told him some filetypes (which i look from help files of evince and okular) . they can open the same filetypes. but don't forget openoffice supports doc files too but it can never open properly %100 like ms office. so that is why i am asking you if evince and okular is on the same level to open their filetypes.
did you look here ?  yes?  http://okular.kde.org/formats.php  also ms office files open generally 100%  in abiword

first sorry for my english. i think i can not explain you the problem. i knwo which filetypes can open okular and evince. they are same filetypes (at least many of them). but the questions is not that. the questiosn is : they both supports the same filetypes at the same level ?
because every program says that we upport bla bla bla formats but they can not support them propely ...
I am not sure   ...what is your native language?
ooo darn I dont speak that at all :(  but all I can suggest is to install okular and test  or abiword  etc  you can always uninstall them cleanly
they are nÄ±t unistalling cleanly :D anyway :)
